byline.contributor: Maggie Haberman reported from Council Bluffs, and Thomas Kaplan from Clinton, Iowa. John Corrales contributed reporting from Council Bluffs.
byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and THOMAS KAPLAN

abstract: Donald J Trump campaign for 2016 presidential election uses mix of flattery and bold unpredictable statements to appeal to Republican voters in Iowa during final campaign events before caucus vote.
lead_paragraph: True to form, Mr. Trump’s closing message to Iowa Republicans heading into Monday night’s caucuses has been unruly, inconsistent, and sometimes unpredictable.

headline.main: Donald Trump Delivers Flurry of Flattery in Iowa
headline.print_headline: Trump Delivers a Flurry of Flattery to Iowa Republicans to Try to Seal the Deal

snippet: True to form, Mr. Trump’s closing message to Iowa Republicans heading into Monday night’s caucuses has been unruly, inconsistent, and sometimes unpredictable.
